00015 /* Class: Lua_wrapper
00016  * Wraps some lua functionality and common procedures.
00017  * */
00018 class Lua_wrapper
00019 {
00020 public:
00021         /* Constructor: Lua_wrapper
00022          * */
00023         Lua_wrapper();
00024         /* Destructor: Lua_wrapper
00025          * */
00026         ~Lua_wrapper();
00027         /* Function: Deinit
00028          * Shuts down lua
00029          * */
00030         void Deinit();
00031         /* Function: Init
00032          * Initializes lua
00033          * 
00034          * Parameters:
00035          * game - the game instance this lua wrapper belongs to.
00036          * */
00037         void Init(Game* game);
00038         /* Function: Load_script
00039          * Loads a script, optionally executing it.
00040          * 
00041          * Parameters:
00042          * filename - scriptfile to load
00043          * call - whether to execute the script, true by default
00044          * */
00045         void Load_script(std::string filename, bool call=true);
00046         /* Function: Call
00047          * Calls a lua function with no arguments except for the caller.
00048          * 
00049          * Parameters:
00050          * function - Which lua function to call
00051          * caller - Which object that called, very commonly used.
00052         */
00053         void Call(std::string function, void* caller);
00054         /* Function: Prepare
00055          * Pushes function global and caller on stack, and allows you to add more arguments before making the call.
00056          * Use <Call(int args)> to execute the function.
00057          * 
00058          * Parameters:
00059          * function - Which lua function to call
00060          * caller - Which object that called, very commonly used.
00061          *
00062          * Returns:
00063          * lua_State for you to push extra arguments
00064         */
00065         lua_State* Prepare(std::string function, void* caller);
00066         /* Function: Call
00067          * Calls a <Prepare>d function
00068          * args is the number of extra arguments you have pushed on the stack
00069         */
00070         void Call(int args);
00071         /* Function: Get_state
00072          * Allows access to the lua_State for doing things this wrapper doesn't wrap.
00073          * 
00074          * Returns:
00075          * The lua_State
00076          * */
00077         lua_State* Get_state();
00078         
00079         /* Function: Get_game
00080          * A global function used to find out which game instance is coupled with a lua_State.
00081          * This is used when getting calls from Lua to access the system.
00082          * 
00083          * Returns:
00084          * the game instance this lua_State belongs to.
00085         */
00086         static Game* Get_game(lua_State* state);
00087 private:
00088         lua_State* state;
00089         static std::map<lua_State*, Game*> gamemap;
00090 };
